Image captions are intended to add context, not to describe what appears in the image.
Image captions are intended to add context, not to describe what appears in the image.
They are made up of Paragraph blocks which can do all the usual things:
They are made up of Paragraph blocks which can do all the usual things: bold, italics, both, hyperlinks, and words in português.
The alt text is intended to describe the image sufficiently that a user who cannot see the image can understand what the image is intended to convey

Media has an optional Caption block which follows the same rules as for Image Captions.
